text: HubL is an implementation of the Jinja language, so you should be able to use most of the syntax, but it doesn’t share any code with Jinja, so there are some minor differences.
Also, I don’t recommend using `.append` as it’s not documented and could disappear/break someday.

The follow me module adds image icons that do not use https. I override them anyways so it’s not really causing me true mixed content issues but it does cause some automated tools to think every page that has a follow me module has mixed content issues, making testing harder. <http://static.hsappstatic.net/social_shared/static-2.4560/img/followme/icon_default.png>
<http://static.hsappstatic.net/social_shared/static-2.4560/img/followme/icon_twitter.png>
<http://static.hsappstatic.net/social_shared/static-2.4560/img/followme/icon_linkedin.png>
<http://static.hsappstatic.net/social_shared/static-2.4560/img/followme/icon_facebook.png>
We dont use the built in one. We roll our own.
We use the built in one as it encourages our clients to get their social accounts hooked up.
plus then no one has to go into the design manager to edit them
